Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Unguent vase
Description: Unguent vase in the regular truncated shape, with slightly flared bottom and a flat and protruding rim.This type of vessel was common among cosmetic equipment and implements found in tombs. It contained makeup, perfume and unguent.
